abstract: At 30 Rockefeller Plaza, in the Art Deco theater that is home to “Saturday Night Live,” humor was not part of the program on Thursday. Instead, General Electric executives were doggedly making the case that the company’s huge finance arm is not just a troubled bank in disguise, as investors have feared.
lead_paragraph: At 30 Rockefeller Plaza, in the Art Deco theater that is home to “Saturday Night Live,” humor was not part of the program on Thursday. Instead, General Electric executives were doggedly making the case that the company’s huge finance arm is not just a troubled bank in disguise, as investors have feared.

headline.main: G.E. Makes a (Very Detailed) Case for Its Finance Unit
